TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MemberChangeConflict extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a situation in which an attempted update fails because member values have been updated since the client last read them.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following example shows how to retrieve information about members in conflict.
## Examples [!code-csharp[System.Data.Linq.MemberChangeConflict#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/system.data.linq.memberchangeconflict/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Data.Linq.MemberChangeConflict#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/system.data.linq.memberchangeconflict/vb/module1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the current value of the member in conflict.
Gets the database value of the member in conflict.
Docs.value: The value of the object in conflict.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the member data has been changed since the last database read or refresh.
Docs.value: if the member data has been changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the property to merge new values without overwriting pending updates.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the conflict has been resolved.
Docs.value: if the conflict has been resolved.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is read-only and is automatically updated as conflicts are resolved.

Docs.summary: Gets metadata information about the member in conflict.
Docs.value: Information about the member in conflict.

Docs.summary: Gets the original value of the member in conflict.
Docs.value: The original value of the member in conflict.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Resolve(valuetype System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode refreshMode) cil managed

Docs.summary: Uses a parameter to automatically specify the value to set as the current value for the member in conflict.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following examples show what results are produced by using the various values for <xref:System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode>.
## Examples The following example overwrites current values with values from the database.
[!code-csharp[System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/system.data.linq.refreshmode/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/system.data.linq.refreshmode/vb/module1.vb#1)]
The following example shows how to swap the original value with the values retrieved from the database. No current value is modified.
[!code-csharp[System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/system.data.linq.refreshmode/cs/program.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/system.data.linq.refreshmode/vb/module1.vb#2)]
The following example keeps the current values that have been changed, but updates the other values with database values.
[!code-csharp[System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/system.data.linq.refreshmode/cs/program.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/system.data.linq.refreshmode/vb/module1.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Resolve(object value) cil managed

Docs.param: The value to set as the current value.
Docs.summary: Specifies the value to set as the current value for the member in conflict.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value set here is the value to be used in a subsequent <xref:System.Data.Linq.DataContext.SubmitChanges%2A> operation.
